name: SearchDatadogEvents
description:
Search and filter events in Datadog.

Use this tool to find and filter events in Datadog using complex search queries. It returns a paginated list of events that match the specified criteria.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The earliest time for requested events, using date math or timestamps in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: The minimum time for the requested events. Supports date math and regular timestamps in milliseconds.

parameters.name: event_search_query
parameters.description: The search query using Datadog's event search syntax to filter events.

value_schema.description: The search query following the event search syntax.

parameters.name: max_event_time
parameters.description: Specify the maximum time for the events. Supports date math and timestamps in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: The maximum time for the requested events. Supports date math and regular timestamps in milliseconds.

parameters.name: time_offset_seconds
parameters.description: The time offset to apply to the query in seconds. Use an integer to specify the shift in time for the search results.

value_schema.description: The time offset to apply to the query in seconds.

parameters.name: timezone
parameters.description: Specify the timezone for the query. It can be GMT, UTC, an offset (like UTC+1), or a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

value_schema.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

parameters.name: paging_cursor
parameters.description: The cursor for pagination to retrieve the next set of results.

value_schema.description: The returned paging point to use to get the next results.

parameters.name: maximum_events_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of events returned per page in the response. This controls the pagination size.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of logs in the response.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Specify event sorting order: 'timestamp' for ascending, '-timestamp' for descending.

value_schema.description: The sort parameters when querying events.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: filter.from
parameters.description: The minimum time for the requested events. Supports date math and regular timestamps in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: The minimum time for the requested events. Supports date math and regular timestamps in milliseconds.

parameters.name: filter.query
parameters.description: The search query following the event search syntax.

value_schema.description: The search query following the event search syntax.

parameters.name: filter.to
parameters.description: The maximum time for the requested events. Supports date math and regular timestamps in milliseconds.

value_schema.description: The maximum time for the requested events. Supports date math and regular timestamps in milliseconds.

parameters.name: options.timeOffset
parameters.description: The time offset to apply to the query in seconds.

value_schema.description: The time offset to apply to the query in seconds.

parameters.name: options.timezone
parameters.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

value_schema.description: The timezone can be specified as GMT, UTC, an offset from UTC (like UTC+1), or as a Timezone Database identifier (like America/New_York).

parameters.name: page.cursor
parameters.description: The returned paging point to use to get the next results.

value_schema.description: The returned paging point to use to get the next results.

parameters.name: page.limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of logs in the response.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of logs in the response.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The sort parameters when querying events.

value_schema.description: The sort parameters when querying events.
